item.title: Marketplace Content Filtering
item.description: Publishers can customize the type of ads that are served in their apps and sites by using the Content Filtering controls.  Publishers can set the filtering level from Strict, Moderate, Low and No Filtering.  Lowering the content filtering usually results in stronger fill and higher CPMs....

item.title: Blocking Advertisers on the Marketplace
item.description: A blocklist allows you to block specific creative and advertisers from displaying ads on your apps. The blocklist can be found on the “Settings” tab within the Marketplace page. Particular advertisers can be blocked by adding the domain name (advertiser URL) of the advertiser to the...

item.title: Turning the Marketplace On
item.description: Go to the Marketplace tab   Click the “On” switch   Turn on all applications and ad units you want to participate in the Marketplace — There is no reason to have these deactivated   Set your price floors—the minimum price that you’re...

item.title: MoPub Marketplace FAQ
item.description: What is the MoPub Marketplace? The MoPub Marketplace is a self-service, real-time bidding exchange for mobile apps and web sites. It enables publishers like you to plug in to more demand sources on the MoPub platform. You can think of a real-time bidding exchange like a real time auction where...

item.title: Ad Network Discrepancies
item.description: The normal range for discrepancies are 5-10%. You should be concerned if discrepancies are 15%+. Below are the different circumstances as to why you may be experiencing discpreancies and the parties responsible for resolving. Custom Native Networks: These are networks that you are integrating the...

item.title: Mobile Web Ad Network Support
item.description: Please note that Mobile Web does not support any Native Networks

item.title: Android Ad Network Support
item.description: The MoPub SDK can mediate any ad network through our server-to-server partners, adapters, and custom events capabilities. A full list of supported networks can be found here. We offer 'plug-and-play' solutions for AdMob, iAd, Chartboost, and Millennial Media. To set these integrations up,...

item.title: Resizing iAd Creative
item.description: If the application is a universal application, there are some standard integration steps to help with resizing of the ad units, particularly when trying to lock down iAd ad sizes.    By following the steps and using the code snippet below, you have the ability to lock down the native...

item.title: iOS Ad Network Support
item.description: The MoPub SDK can mediate any ad network through our server-to-server partners, adapters, and custom events capabilities. A full list of supported networks can be found here. We offer 'plug-and-play' solutions for AdMob, iAd, Chartboost, and Millennial Media. To set these integrations up,...

item.title: Attempts vs. Requests
item.description: When an ad is called, a request is logged within MoPub. An attempt is logged every time MoPub attempts an ad network. There can be several attempts made per request. For example, a request is made to MoPub. There are 3 ad networks that can fill this request. An attempt is made to each ad network...

item.title: Prioritizing Networks
item.description: MoPub’s ad server prioritizes campaigns by eCPM, allowing us to give more space to the networks that are performing well at this very moment. The system works like a waterfall – it will attempt to show ads to the highest eCPM ad network first, and if it cannot fill, will trickle down to...

item.title: Setting Up Ad Network IDs
item.description: Each of the ad networks will provide you a unique ID that you will enter next to your applications when creating a new network order. Below you will find where you can find each of those IDs for AdMob, AdSense, TapIt, InMobi, Jumptap, Millennial Media, Mojiva S2S & MobFox.

item.title: Ad Networks FAQ
item.description: What networks does MoPub support? MoPub supports dozens of the most popular ad networks via server-to-server connections. For a list of standard supported networks, visit here. In addition to these networks, you can set up any network on MoPub via a "Custom Event". These...

item.title: MoPub OpenRTB 2.1 Specification
item.description: Updated August 4,2014 1. Overview MoPub RTB is a way for DSPs and advertisers to bid on each ad impression where the winning bid will pay the second-highest price in the auction. This protocol is largely based on the OpenRTB 2.1 specification. Note that our adaptation may require certain...

item.title: Mobile sign in flow
item.description: Mobile flow The UI flow for mobile web browsers works exactly like the Browser sign in flow, but is optimized for mobile browsers. Below are screenshots for the signed in, signed out, and redirect screens:

item.title: GET geo/similar_places
item.description: Locates places near the given coordinates which are similar in name.
